open.author.name: Marek Marecki
message:
Count register use of functions

Assembler is able to determine how many registers a function uses.
This information should be used on the call sites.

The user should not have to write "allocate this many registers" if
the assembler already knows how many are needed for a particular function.
The writer of the function should be able to override assembler's decision, though.

Current syntax:

    -- .function: <name>/<arity>
    .function: foo/0

    -- frame <no-of-parameters> <no-of-local-registers>
    frame %2 %8

Proposed syntax:

    -- ".function:" <name>/<arity> "registers" [ [ spec | "auto" ] local ] [ [ spec | "auto" ] static ]
    .function: foo/0 registers %8 local %16 static

    -- frame <no-of-parameters>
    frame %2
